titles.title: Contracting Out Appeals Reform Act of 1988

A bill to amend title 31, United States Code, to permit the Comptroller General of the United States to review and decide protests of Federal Government employees relating to converting certain functions performed by such employees to contractor performance, to require the heads of Federal agencies responsible for determining whether to convert to contractor performance any commercial activities of such agencies to regularly consult with employees who will be affected by such determinations, and for other purposes.

bill.summary: 10/5/1988--Introduced. Contracting Out Appeals Reform Act of 1988 - Amends Federal law on the procurement protest system to permit the Comptroller General of the United States to review and decide protests of Federal Government employees relating to conversion to contractor performance of certain functions they perform. Subjects decisions of the Comptroller General on procurement protests to judicial review. Requires heads of Federal agencies who are responsible for determining whether to convert to contractor performance to regularly consult with employees who will be affected by such determination.
